milestones: Milestone at world's largest cleanup site: Hanford nuclear basin removed

President Bush to limit congressional oversight in PATRIOT amendment act
Taiwan breaks bicycle parade world record
California employees owe state US$13.3 million in unpaid loans
Outrage in Mexico after Sheraton Hotel evicts Cuban officials
Wolfowitz to quit as head of the World Bank
Australian foreign minister tells inquiry it was the UN's job to investigate Iraq kickback claims
Three Walmart superstores open in Canada
Four British Airways executives charged with price fixing
Nominees of 2007 Taiwan Sports Elite Awards announced and acknowledged
Alaska senator Ted Stevens indicted in corruption scandal

Man arrested for broadcasting Hezbollah television in New York
Darling announces UK budget for 2009
George W. Bush nominates EPA Administrator Mike Leavitt as health secretary
Swan in Fife, Scotland dies with H5N1 bird flu virus infection
2008 e21FORUM: Intel confronts Microsoft again
Jemaah Islamiyah leader Mas Selamat escapes from Singapore prison

wiki.text:
The 'executive' is the part of government that has sole authority and
responsibility for the daily administration of the state.<ref>[http://dictionar-
y.reference.com/browse/Executive+Branch&fromAsk=true Executive Branch],
www.dictionary.reference.com</ref> The executive branch executes the law. The
division of power into separate branches of government is central to the idea of
the separation of
powers.<ref>[http://www.reference.com/browse/separation%20of%20powers ...
central to the idea of Separation of Powers], www.reference.com</ref>

In some countries, the term "government" connotes only the executive branch.
However, this usage fails to differentiate between despotic and democratic forms
of government. In authoritarian systems, such as a dictatorship or absolute
monarchy, where the different powers of government are assumed by one person or
small oligarchy, the executive branch ceases to exist since there is no other
branch with which to share separate but equal governmental powers.

The separation of powers system is designed to distribute authority among
several branches â€” an attempt to preserve individual liberty in response to
tyrannical leadership throughout
history.<ref>[http://www.constitution.org/fed/federa51.htm ... an attempt to
preserve individual liberty], The Federalist Papers #51</ref> The executive
officer is not supposed to make laws (the role of the legislature) or interpret
them (the role of the judiciary). The role of the executive is to enforce the
law as written by the legislature and interpreted by the judicial system.
wiki.title: executive%20%28government%29
